Discipline Is Beautiful: why every bathroom deserves an operations plan.

From apartment scouts to barnhouse tacticians, our members agree: daily floss drills are less about vanity and more about controlled force, steady breathing, and good whisker posture.

Letters To The Litter Box Editor

  • From Sir Tofu, indoor cooperative: "Please print more on post-floss stretching. My jaw cramps during monsoon."

Classified Pawges

For Sale: Cedar floss holster with brass clasp, gently pawed, includes training booklet. 18 whiskers.

Seeking: Dawn patrol partner in West Rooftop. Must arrive quiet, carry own mirror, respect cadence.

Trade: Two rolls mint line for one spool clove line. No kittens under six moons.

Services: Mobile knot inspection, apartment-to-apartment. Flat rate, no judgment, tea accepted.

Corrections & Clarifications

On February 5, we reported that braided silk causes heroic posture in all adult toms. The desk corrects this to "some toms, after proper hydration."

Yesterday's weather map mislabeled the east sink as "tooth zone alpha." It remains "rinse corridor." We regret the tactical confusion.

A headline in last week's broadsheet read "String Is Mercy." It should have read "String Is Method."

Service Notes

Membership: 29 whiskers/month includes weekend bulletins and two emergency line drops.

Quartermaster Box: 54 whiskers/month includes four seasonal threads, wax gauge cards, and one enamel claw pin.

Household Unit: 88 whiskers/month covers up to four cats and a shared sink protocol chart.

The Catgut Ledger is published by Catgut Civic Supply, a cooperative devoted to disciplined oral linework, community safety, and elegant bathroom logistics.

Head Office: 17 Yarn Exchange, Third Floor, North Stair. Dispatch bell: 05:40 and 20:10 daily.

No plastic picks. No panic. Keep line taut.
